page.title: 15NATURE RESERVE ON ARNE
page.content: The RSPB has had a nature reserve at Arne since l965.The main habitat is open heathland which is one of the few remaining areas in Britain where the rare Dartford Warbler breeds.All the British species of reptile live here, including adders and sand lizards. A nature trail, 3/4 of a mile long, the only area to which visitors have access runs through the reserve, leading visitors through several different habitats.The trail starts in deciduous woodland consisting of mature common oaks,and sweet chestnut, planted as cover for pheasants.Ground cover consists of broad buckler fern, ivy,bramble, bracken and holly.Some silver birches have witches broom in their branches.This is a growth caused by a fungus Taphrina turgida,and has no detrimental effect on the trees.
